permanent.title: Dual Processor
permanent.effect: Once per round, you may program two cards in one register. Those cards are executed consecutively with the bottom card executing first.

permanent.title: Admin Privilege
permanent.effect: Once per round, you may give your robot priority for one register.

permanent.title: Corruption Wave
permanent.effect: You may put SPAM damage cards you deal on top of opponents’ decks.

permanent.title: Blue Screen of Death
permanent.effect: When you shoot or push an adjacent robot, you may give that player one worm damage card instead of one SPAM damage card.

permanent.title: Crab Legs
permanent.effect: When executing a Move 1 card, you may move one space forward then one space right or left, without rotating and regardless of the direction you are facing. Then move forward one additional space in the direction you are facing.

permanent.title: Brakes
permanent.effect: You may treat your Move 1’s as Move 0’s.

permanent.title: Deflector Shield
permanent.effect: At the beginning of a register, you may spend one energy to negate any robot lasers that would hit you that register.

permanent.title: Cache Memory
permanent.effect: You may discard cards from your hand and place them on the top of your deck. Do not draw replacement cards.

permanent.title: Defrag Gizmo
permanent.effect: Once during each round, you may permanently discard one damage card from your hand. Draw a replacement card from the top of your deck.

permanent.title: Double Barrel Laser
permanent.effect: Deal one additional SPAM damage card to any robot you shoot.

permanent.title: Modular Chassis
permanent.effect: When you push another robot, give that player this card, and take one of their installed upgrades. That player keeps this card until they use it.

permanent.title: Firewall
permanent.effect: Take no SPAM damage cards when rebooting.

permanent.title: Pressor Beam
permanent.effect: You may push any robot you shoot one space in the direction you are shooting.

permanent.title: Hover Unit
permanent.effect: Your robot can pass over, but not land on, pits. If you end your move on a pit, you fall in. You can’t turn off Hover Unit, and you can’t hover above another robot.

permanent.title: Rail Gun
permanent.effect: You may shoot through any number of walls and/or robots. Robots in the line of fire take one SPAM damage card.

permanent.title: Memory Stick
permanent.effect: Draw one additional programming card at the start of each round.

permanent.title: Ramming Gear
permanent.effect: Deal one SPAM damage card when you push a robot.

permanent.title: Mini Howitzer
permanent.effect: Once per register, when you shoot, you may pay one energy to deal two additional SPAM damage cards and push the attacked robot one space in the direction you are shooting.

permanent.title: Rear Laser
permanent.effect: Your robot may shoot backwards as well as forward.

permanent.title: Scrambler
permanent.effect: If you attack a robot, that player replaces the card in their next register with the top card of their deck, unless it is the final register.

permanent.title: Tractor Beam
permanent.effect: When you shoot a robot, you may pull it toward you one space. Tractor beam may not be used on adjacent robots.

permanent.title: Side Arms
permanent.effect: When you push a robot, you may choose to push it to the left or right instead of the direction you are facing.

permanent.title: Trojan Needler
permanent.effect: When you shoot or push a robot, target robot receives damage in the form of one Trojan horse damage card instead of one SPAM damage card.

permanent.title: Teleporter
permanent.effect: You may pay one energy to ignore obstacles when moving. This includes walls, pits, the priority antenna, and robots; however, you may not end your move on a wall, pit, or the priority antenna. If you move to a space with another robot, swap places with that robot.

permanent.title: Virus Module
permanent.effect: When you push a robot, give that player a virus damage card.

temporary.title: Boink
temporary.effect: Move to an adjacent space. Do not change direction.

temporary.title: Hack
temporary.effect: Execute the programming in your current register again. This action does not replace any existing programming.

temporary.title: Energy Routine
temporary.effect: Add the Energy Routine programming card to your discard pile. It is now permanently part of your deck. The Energy Routine programming card acts as an extra Power Up card in your programming deck.

temporary.title: Manual Sort
temporary.effect: You may give your robot priority for this register. This card overrides Admin Privilege.

temporary.title: Memory Swap
temporary.effect: Draw three cards. Then choose three from your hand to put on top of your deck.

temporary.title: Repeat Routine
temporary.effect: Add the Repeat Routine programming card to your discard pile. It is now permanently part of your deck. The Repeat Routine programming card acts as an extra Again card in your programming deck.

temporary.title: Reboot
temporary.effect: Reboot your robot, but take no damage.

temporary.title: Sandbox Routine
temporary.effect: Add the Sandbox Routine programming card to your discard pile. It is now permanently part of your deck. The Sandbox Routine programming card allows you to choose one of the following actions to perform in the register where it is programmed: Move 1, 2, or 3; Back Up; Turn Left; Turn Right; U-Turn.

temporary.title: SPAM Blocker
temporary.effect: Replace each SPAM damage card in your hand with a card from the top of your deck. Immediately discard the SPAM damage cards by placing them in the SPAM damage card draw pile. If you draw new SPAM damage cards from your deck, keep them in your hand for this round.

temporary.title: Recompile
temporary.effect: Discard your entire hand. Draw a new one. If you need to reshuffle your discard pile to replenish your deck, you may.

temporary.title: SPAM Folder Routine
temporary.effect: Add the SPAM Folder programming card to your discard pile. It is now permanently part of your deck. The SPAM Folder programming card allows you to permanently discard one SPAM damage card from your discard pile.

temporary.title: Refresh
temporary.effect: Change the programming in your current register to any of the following: Move 1, 2, or 3; Turn Left; Turn Right; U-Turn; Back Up; Again. If you’re replacing a damage card, you may permanently discard the damage card.

temporary.title: Speed Routine
temporary.effect: Add the Speed Routine programming card to your discard pile. It is now permanently part of your deck. The Speed Routine programming card acts as an extra Move 3 card in your programming deck.

temporary.title: Weasel Routine
temporary.effect: Add the Weasel Routine programming card to your discard pile. It is now permanently part of your deck. The Weasel Routine programming card allows you to choose one of the following actions to perform in the register where it is programmed: Turn Left, Turn Right, U-Turn.
